items.question: What is .latino?
items.answer: .latino is a new top-level domain (TLD) designed specifically for the global Latino community. Like .com or .org, it's the ending of a web address — but .latino instantly signals cultural identity, heritage, and community connection.

items.question: Who can register a .latino domain?
items.answer: .latino is open to anyone who identifies with or serves the Latino community — businesses, creators, nonprofits, media outlets, and individuals worldwide. There are no geographic restrictions.

items.question: When will .latino domains be available?
items.answer: We're currently in the pre-launch phase. Registration will open in phases — starting with a Trademark Sunrise period, followed by Early Access, Limited Registration, and finally General Availability. Sign up for notifications to be first in line.

items.question: How much will a .latino domain cost?
items.answer: Pricing will vary by registrar and will be announced closer to launch. Sign up for our mailing list to receive pricing details as soon as they're available.

items.question: Can I use .latino for a website in any language?
items.answer: Absolutely. While .latino celebrates Latino heritage, your website can be in any language — English, Spanish, Portuguese, or any other. The domain represents identity, not language limitation.

items.question: How is .latino different from .lat?
items.answer: While .lat serves the broader Latin American region, .latino is specifically designed for the global Latino community and diaspora — including the 63M+ Latinos in the United States, Latin America, and everywhere Latinos call home.

items.question: Will .latino domains include HTTPS?
items.answer: Yes. All .latino domains support modern HTTPS encryption standards, ensuring your website is secure and trusted from day one.

items.question: Where can I register my .latino domain?
items.answer: When registration opens, .latino domains will be available through major registrars including GoDaddy, Namecheap, and others. Check back here or sign up for notifications.

items.question: Can I transfer an existing domain to .latino?
items.answer: Once .latino is live, standard domain transfer processes will apply. Contact your registrar for specifics.

items.question: Who operates the .latino registry?
items.answer: .latino is operated by Dish DBS Corporation. For registry-level inquiries, contact us.
